task_summary: The robot arm is tasked to open the oven door by locating, grasping, and pulling it using a side grasp.

task_long_description.overview: This episode depicts a robot arm interacting with a kitchen oven. The robot must detect and localize the oven door, approach and align with the grasp point, plan a side grasp, execute the grasp, and then pull the oven door open. Each phase leverages visual feedback and motion primitives tailored for rigid handles and hinged doors. Recovery against perception failures is provided via multiple scan attempts, and outcome verification uses the door open sensor. Key constraints include motion safety, reliable grasping, and successful actuation of the door in the correct direction.
preconditions: Robot arm is powered and ready.
Oven door is closed and accessible.
stepwise_plan: Check if oven door is visible; scan if needed.
Move arm above oven door to pregrasp position.
Approach and align with the grasp handle.
Pull oven door open with sufficient distance.
Verify oven door is now open.
success_criteria: Oven door visibly open beyond threshold.
No collision or unsafe motions occurred.
failure_and_recovery: Perception fail: retry scan for door.
Grasp fail: recompute and retry approach.
Door stuck: attempt pull multiple times.
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends when oven door is confirmed open and robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks visual detection of oven door.
Scans scene for oven door using raster pattern.
Detects oven door and extracts pose.
Moves arm above oven door to pregrasp height.
Approaches oven door handle and aligns with tight tolerance.
Computes grasp pose for oven door using side grasp.
Executes grasp at computed pose using side strategy.
Pulls oven door open (perpendicular to oven face).
Checks whether oven door is now open.
Moves arm away after door is open.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan for oven door up to 3 times
Reattempt grasp or alignment on error
Aborts if open condition not met after action
assumptions: Frames clearly show robot approaching and interacting with oven door; grasp handle side strategy inferred from arm configuration.
The oven handle is graspable with 'side' strategy; exact handle geometry not specified by instruction but inferred from images.
Instruction did not specify force; no manual override of port bins.
Instruction did not request retries, but scan fallback uses 3 attempts as per episode progression.
Action sequence strictly matches frame progression; adjustments based on observed motion phases.

expected_success_criteria: The oven door visibly transitions from closed to open in final frames.
The robot arm successfully pulls the door with correct grasp and direction.
